ManagerFragment: Fix Substratum being too fast for Andromeda

We must delay the file read when talking to Andromeda, since we were expecting it to be as fast as sysserv or interfacer, as we are reading files, give it at least 0.5s to process.

title: PackageModificationDetector: Strictly enforce themes not for Samsung
message:
PackageModificationDetector: Strictly enforce themes not for Samsung

* When a substratum theme deliberately including the Substratum_Samsung support as false, the user will receive a notification alerting them that the Themer refused to allow a specific theme to be installed on the device.
* This will also hide it from showing up on the main Theme Fragment so the user is not even able to launch the theme at all.
* This is adapted for the Samsung Oreo Beta, as well as all predecessor Samsung Experience/Touchwiz versions.
* This will not affect themes that do not have Substratum_Samsung specified in their manifest, only those that do, and have it set to false.

title: Overlays: Optimize and speed up
message:
Overlays: Optimize and speed up

* Do not constantly pulsate the Overlay's RV when we reload, for MUCH better UX
* OMS devices no longer heavily and excessively refresh
* Properly fix Compile and Update and Enable/Disable modes from interfering
* Properly fix duplicate calls of compilation happening subsequently
* Fix type2's not showing up as a proper name
* Consolidate the constantly volatile booleans of compile mode to parameters inside the method instead, so we don't have to stand on twigs when handling this file. This also means that we use less declared global variables inside Overlays.java and placed back to their corresponding areas.
* Remove a bunch of redundant code used over the years
* As of this commit, the Overlays, OverlaysManager and OverlaysInstance have been sped up and optimized to the point where it reflects the performance of the original OMS we used to know and love

title: Substratum: Fix splashscreen layout for subsequent launches
message:
Substratum: Fix splashscreen layout for subsequent launches

* The new animation from Piere removed the image view
  we used to show the static logo for subsequent launches,
  resulting in the splash screen being a simple white page
  with the loading spinner. Ugly.
* Fix this by bringing back the ImageView and manipulating
  the visibilities of the animated and static logos inside
  SplashScreenActivity.

Fixes: e322c38ceef6b4dc9403ad5edff4732e49c6f525

title: SubstratumRebase: Full cleanup, ButterKnife, JavaDocs
message:
SubstratumRebase: Full cleanup, ButterKnife, JavaDocs

This commit completely rebases the way Substratum is now formatted.

- Most crucial functions within activities/fragments with views are now
clearly documented with JavaDocs. This will set forth a better way of
documenting code for people outside of the team.

- Fix incorrect LG framework naming in one position by using our global
variable system in Resources.java.
Resources.java now houses a bunch of variables used to communicate
amongst Fragments and Activities, as well as common variables that can
now be directly referenced instead of written as a String. Meaning if
the format of a feature in our template is renamed, we can just change
one variable to save ourselves time.

- Integrate the ButterKnife dependency, of which was a long time need
from my end, but due to most contributors are AOSP/Platform devs, using
foreign externalized frameworks are rather alien to them. At this point
in time, we will start shifting Substratum to a more "reactive" future!

- Fixed a few miscellaneous incorrectly named directories in
ProfileFragment.

- Removed Force Stop Interfacer settings toggle, including all
subsequent properties

- Removed excessive use of "this." and "final" with the previous lint
commit pushes.

- Split up all the activity internal calls to a new enum named Internal.
This will house the variables shared between multiple fragments and
activities.

- Fix the main activity's search function after the DiffUtil commit, as
well as improve the accuracy of the ManagerFragment's search filters

- Fixed a bug where enabling an uncompiled overlay would show the
progress bar

- Fixed a bug where two lunchBars show subsequently when swapping states
in Overlays tab

title: Fix compatibility with gradle 4.3+
message:
Fix compatibility with gradle 4.3+

Previous versions of Gradle would fall through to the next repository if resolution in one repository failed. This behaviour might cause potentially nondeterministic resolution result. Now Gradle will explicitly rethrow exceptions which occur in dependency resolution instead of quietly continue to the next repository.

title: SubstratumRebase: Clean up lint warnings as of AS 3.0 RC 1
message: SubstratumRebase: Clean up lint warnings as of AS 3.0 RC 1

title: Remove unused logging
message: Remove unused logging

title: fix lint warning condition result=0 is always true
message: fix lint warning condition result=0 is always true

title: fix lint warning string equals empty
message:
fix lint warning string equals empty

Reports .equals() being called to compare a String with an empty string. It is normally more performant to test a String for emptiness by comparing its .length() to zero instead.

title: fix lint warning single character string concatenation
message:
fix lint warning single character string concatenation

Reports String literals of length one being used in concatenation. These literals may be replaced by equivalent character literals, gaining some performance enhancement.

title: fix lint warning single character argument in string.indexof
message:
fix lint warning single character argument in string.indexof

Reports String literals of length one being used as a parameter in String.indexOf() or String.lastIndexOf() calls. These String literals may be replaced by equivalent character literals, gaining some performance enhancement.

title: fix lint warning method may be static
message:
fix lint warning method may be static

Reports any methods which may safely be made static. A method may be static if it is not synchronized, it does not reference any of its class' non static methods and non static fields and is not overridden in a sub class.

title: fix lint warning iteration over keyset may be replaced with entryset iteration
message:
fix lint warning iteration over keyset may be replaced with entryset iteration

Reports iteration over the keySet() of a java.util.Map instance, where the iterated keys are used to retrieve the values from the map. Such iteration may be more efficiently replaced by iteration over the entrySet() of the map.

title: fix lint warning field may be static
message:
fix lint warning field may be static

Reports any instance variables which may safely be made static. A field may be static if it is declared final, and is initialized with a constant.

title: fix lint warning concatenation with empty string
message:
fix lint warning concatenation with empty string

Reports string concatenations where one of the arguments is the empty string. Such a concatenation is unnecessary and inefficient, particularly when used as an idiom for formatting non-String objects or primitives into Strings.

title: fix lint warning Collection.addAll can be replaced with parametrized constructor
message:
fix lint warning Collection.addAll can be replaced with parametrized constructor

Inspection reports usages of Collection.addAll() and Map.putAll() methods after instantiation of object using parameter-less constructor.

title: fix lint warning call to simple getter from within class
message:
fix lint warning call to simple getter from within class

Reports any calls to a simple property getter from within the property's class. A simple property getter is defined as one which simply returns the value of a field, and does no other calculation. Such simple getter calls may be safely inlined, at a small performance improvement. Some coding standards also suggest against the use of simple getters for code clarity reasons.

title: fix lint warning non reproducible call to java.lang.math
message:
fix lint warning non reproducible call to java.lang.math

Reports any calls to java.lang.Math methods whose results are not guaranteed to be precisely reproducible. In environments where reproducibility of results are needed, java.lang.StrictMath should be used instead.

title: fix lint warning implicit numeric conversion
message:
fix lint warning implicit numeric conversion

Reports implicit conversion between numeric types. Implicit numeric conversion is not a problem in itself, but if unexpected may be a source of difficult to trace bugs.

title: fix lint warning double literal cast to float could be float literal
message:
fix lint warning double literal cast to float could be float literal

Reports double literal expressions which are immediately cast to float. Such literal expressions can be replaced with the equivalent float literal.

title: fix lint warning inner class may be static
message:
fix lint warning inner class may be static

Reports any inner classes which may safely be made static. An inner class may be static if it doesn't reference its enclosing instance.
A static inner class does not keep an implicit reference to its enclosing instance. This prevents a common cause of memory leaks and uses less memory per instance of the class.

title: fix lint warning multiply or device by power of two
message:
fix lint warning multiply or device by power of two

Reports multiplication of an integer value by a constant power of 2. These expressions may be replaced by right or left shift operations, for a possible performance improvement.

title: fix lint warning redundant suppresion
fix lint warning doverly broad throws clause
message:
fix lint warning doverly broad throws clause

Reports throws clauses which contain exceptions which are more generic than the exceptions actually thrown by the method.

title: fix lint warning decleration can have final modifier
message:
fix lint warning decleration can have final modifier

This inspection reports all fields, methods or classes, found in the specified inspection scope, that may have a final modifier added to their declarations.

title: fix lint warning decleration access can be weaker
message:
fix lint warning decleration access can be weaker

This inspection reports all fields, methods or classes, found in the specified inspection scope, that may have their access modifier narrowed down.

title: fix lint warning scope of variable is too broad
message:
fix lint warning scope of variable is too broad

Reports any variable declarations which can be moved to a smaller scope. Especially useful for Pascal style declarations at the start of a method, but variables with too broad a scope are also often left over after refactorings.

title: fix lint warning redunant local variable
message:
fix lint warning redunant local variable

Reports unnecessary local variables, which add nothing to the comprehensibility of a method. Variables caught include local variables which are immediately returned, local variables that are immediately assigned to another variable and then not used, and local variables which always have the same value as another local variable or parameter.

title: fix lint warning boolean expression could be replaced by conditional expression
message:
fix lint warning boolean expression could be replaced by conditional expression

Reports any boolean expressions which can be expressed more compactly, and arguably more clearly, as a conditional expression. Take for example the following expression:
which may be expressed as:
a ? b : c;

title: fix lint warning unclear expression
message:
fix lint warning unclear expression

Reports binary, conditional or instanceof expressions consisting of multiple terms with different operators without parentheses. Such expressions can be unclear because not every developer is intimately familiar with all the precedence rules of the different operators. This inspection has a quickfix which adds clarifying parentheses.

title: fix lint warning size == 0 replacable with isEmpty
message:
fix lint warning size == 0 replacable with isEmpty

Reports any .size() or .length() comparisons with a 0 literal which can be replaced with a call to .isEmpty().

title: fix lint warning redundant field intialization
message:
fix lint warning redundant field intialization

Reports fields explicitly initialized to the same values that the JVM would initialize them to by default.

title: fix lint warning redundant new expression in constant array creation
message:
fix lint warning redundant new expression in constant array creation

Reports any constant new array expression, like int[] a = new int[]{42} which can be replaced with an array initializer, e.g. int[] a = {42}. Array initializers omit the type declaration because that is already specified by the declaration of the variable the expression is assigned to.

title: fix lint warning missorted modifiers
message:
fix lint warning missorted modifiers

Reports on declarations whose modifiers are not in the canonical preferred order as stated in the Java Language Specification.

title: flip some constants to the right to match code style
message: flip some constants to the right to match code style

title: suppress false positive can be final on builder and dialogueClickListener
message: suppress false positive can be final on builder and dialogueClickListener

title: fix lint warning local variable or parameter can be final
message:
fix lint warning local variable or parameter can be final

This inspection reports parameters or local variables, found in the specified inspection scope, that may have a final modifier added

title: fix lint warning instant method call not qualified with this
message:
fix lint warning instant method call not qualified with this

Reports calls to non-static methods of the same object which are not qualified with this.

title: fix lint warning instant field access not qualified with this
message:
fix lint warning instant field access not qualified with this

Reports on field accesses which are not qualified with this or some other qualifier. Some coding styles mandate that all field accesses are qualified to prevent confusion with local variable or parameter accesses.

title: silence lint by marking these as implictly used
message: silence lint by marking these as implictly used

title: fix lint warning implicit call to super
message:
fix lint warning implicit call to super

Reports constructors which do not begin with calls to super constructor, or other constructors of the same class. Such constructors can be thought of as implicitly beginning with a call to super(). Some coding standards prefer that such calls to super() be made explicitly.

title: fix lint warning field may be final
message:
fix lint warning field may be final

Reports any fields which may safely be made final. A static field may be final if it is initialized in its declaration or in one static class initializer, but not both. A non-static field may be final if it is initialized in its declaration or in one non-static class initializer or in all constructors.

title: Clean up and refactor after cherry pick
message: Clean up and refactor after cherry pick

title: fix lint error by flipping equals
message:
fix lint error by flipping equals
Reports calls to .equals() whose arguments are String literals. Some coding standards specify that String literals should be the target of .equals(), rather than argument, thus minimizing NullPointerExceptions.

title: SubstratumUX: If a theme was upgraded in the background, relaunch IA
message:
SubstratumUX: If a theme was upgraded in the background, relaunch IA

So let's say Play Store automatically updated a theme while you have InformationActivity open, you don't want to see old resources such as the old hero image and the old overlay names and types. 

The activity will now automatically restart, as well as gracefully finishing if the user is compiling a theme at that time.

NOTE: If by some chance the user updates the theme during an overlay install session, and the theme updates in between, the subsequently compiled overlays will be up to date. The activity will restart after due to the gracefully finishing code.

title: SettingsFragment: Silently consume IllegalStateException in ROM support check
message:
SettingsFragment: Silently consume IllegalStateException in ROM support check

* Even though we do check for the settingsFragment object not being null
  before we start with the process of setting the strings back, if this process is
  slow for any reason and the user toggles the secondary drawer layout
  between this flow of execution, the activity recreation will detach the fragment
  causing an ISE ultimately crashing the app. Silently consume exception if this is
  the case.

title: ThemeAdapter: Display adaptive Icons properly on the ThemeInformation Sheet
message:

If a theme uses an adaptiveIcon, its not shaped correctly. Use icon.setImageDrawable instead of icon.setImageBitmap to fix this.

title: References: Improve adaptiveIcon handling in createAppShortcut method
message:
References: Improve adaptiveIcon handling in createAppShortcut method
Currently adaptive Icons can be added as Shortcuts, but they are not treated as adaptive Icons by the Launcher. Instead
of getting shaped correctly, the whole Icon (square) is shown.
Using Icon.createWithAdaptiveBitmap instead of Icon.createWithBitmap when an adaptiveIcon is detected fixes this issue.

title: References: Prevent createAppShortcut fail on themes with adaptive icons
message:
References: Prevent createAppShortcut fail on themes with adaptive icons

* Packages.getAppIcon returns a Drawable object which is a
  AdaptiveIconDrawable in case of adaptive icons. These cannot
  be cast into a BitmapDrawable as is, and thus require the tooling
  present in the Packages#getBitmapFromDrawable method. To amend
  the cause of the crash, simply wrap the Packages#getAppIcon
  method with Packages#getBitmapFromDrawable in the call for it
  inside References#createLauncherIcon to prevent crashing out
  due to an illegal cast.

* Also remove an unused method in References.

Signed-off-by: Harsh Shandilya <msfjarvis@gmail.com>

message:
It's not 2015, we no longer need to use the caching system after DA

* This completely destroys the existence of caching mode in Substratum
* There is A LOT of redundant, dead code with non-DA set ups, so we have
to remove it for a higher performance code runtime and readability.
* Ensured that all SharedPreferences no longer writes "is_updating"
* Ensured all checks for caching has been moved to DA
* Wiped all strings to start fresh, just in case

title: AndromedaBinderService: Do not fire notifications multiple times
message:
AndromedaBinderService: Do not fire notifications multiple times

At certain times, Substratum (Application.class) may try to ressurrect the service with the START_STICKY tag. If the disconnected notification is showing, do not fire again and do not launch Andromeda again, minimizing possible duplicate stacks of Andromeda and SystemUI notification duplicates after clear.

title: InformationActivity: Glide; do not use any cache
message:
InformationActivity: Glide; do not use any cache

This should fix the sporadic events that plague the randomness of the hero image changing to another theme. Not only does this commit remove the static variables called from nested fragments in an activity, but it shifts them to bundles where all tabs can call the bundle thanks to the adapter.

The BootCompletedDetector will always ensure that the Glide cache will be cleared and memory will be wiped. No longer do any of the Glide loads cache onto the memory (except online to reduce multiple calls), but it ensures that it won't run off memory.

Finally, no longer do we call to initialize the hero image twice when launching themes (for the options menu icon color analysis) and thus it would allow bigger themes to load significantly faster.

title: MainActivity: Do not show outdated dialog when the user is too fast
message:
MainActivity: Do not show outdated dialog when the user is too fast

When we queue using ThemeManager.listEnabledOverlays, it takes a while to update on the OMS side and thus, when it returns a list of overlays in /data/system/overlays.xml, it has a refresh delay and when we queue for the packages stated in the outdated overlay.xml, it will error out with a PackageNotFoundException, which returns 0 -> the trigger for outdated overlay dialog.

title: SubstratumCrash: When the app crashes randomly, catch it
message:
SubstratumCrash: When the app crashes randomly, catch it

This also checks if the crash was based on ResourceNotFoundException or InflateException, which we all know is what happens when an overlay targeting Substratum is out of date and the resource pointers are shifted in the wrong place. It will pulsate the Rescue Me! button to be eye catching for the user.

title: Merge pull request #126 from arter97/dev
message:
Merge pull request #126 from arter97/dev

ZipAlign APKs

title: ZipAlign APKs
message:
ZipAlign APKs

Mis-aligned APKs cause serious performance issues like
increased memory footprint and CPU usage.

Most of the complaints of "substratum makes your device slower"
will be due to this.

 - Rename "AOPTCheck" to "CheckBinaries"
   as another native executable is added along side with aapt/aopt.

 - zipalign binaries are built from android-7.0.0_r33
   to maintain compatibility with minSdkVersion(24).
   arm32/arm64/x86 are supported.

 - runShellCommands() from SubstratumBuilder.java has been renamed to
   runAOPTShellCommands() as it is not suitable to call other
   native executables.
   Since zipalign's command line is extremely simple, it is done inline.

Signed-off-by: Park Ju Hyung <qkrwngud825@gmail.com>

title: WeakReferences: Prepare null check garbage collection per async phase
message:
WeakReferences: Prepare null check garbage collection per async phase

It should be noted that once we assign a weak reference variable (WeakReference<Object> wr = new WeakReference<>(objectType)) and attempted to wr.get() we have a strong reference, however, we must check if the obtained strong reference is null or not because the contents may be garbage collected during the Android lifecycle.

title: ProfileFragment: Use EditView.getText().clear()
message:
ProfileFragment: Use EditView.getText().clear()

This is the recommended method of setting an EditView to blank,
setText("") is for TextView

title: ProfileFragment: Fix code duplication
message:
ProfileFragment: Fix code duplication

When the profile_selector Spinner is instantiated, an ArrayList
and ArrayAdapter are created for it to inflate values from. The
code that populates the ArrayList was duplicated from the RefreshSpinner
method. We create and assign the ArrayList and ArrayAdapter as blank
entities then call the RefreshSpinner method to populate the ArrayList,
allowing us to get rid of the duplicate code.

title: ProfileFragment: Clear profile name after saving
message:
ProfileFragment: Clear profile name after saving

Having the profile name linger after saving might suggest to some
users that the operation was unsuccessful, despite the LunchBar telling
them otherwise. Clear the name out to avoid the situation.

Currently when a lunchbar is spawned and the fab menu is invoked, it would not take account for the lunchbar and fab position shift and cause the fab to constantly move up the screen.

 This commit remedies that behaviour and dismisses the lunchbar before opening the menu - also the case scenario when lunchbar is not open has been taken account for and will not have a delay.

title: AOPTCheck: remove the memory overhead caused by the unnecessary check
message:
AOPTCheck: remove the memory overhead caused by the unnecessary check

since the value of integrityCheck will never be null, and since the check output is
redirected to stdout, it saves us a bufferedread.

Despite the memory overhead savings being minimal, the check in and of itself is essentially
whether the user is selecitng stable orcutting edge version. So lets remove the check.

title: OverlayUpdater: Staticize and Reorganize
message:
OverlayUpdater: Staticize and Reorganize

This fixes issues with momentary detection of new overlays installing an update, then tripping up the updater. By making it static, it will compile overlays by instances.

title: EncryptedAssets: Perform handshake with theme package to update overlays
message:
EncryptedAssets: Perform handshake with theme package to update overlays

To blindly update overlays, themes will have to willingly hand over a copy of their encrypted decryption key and IV spec decryption key directly to Substratum.

Usually we can do all of this all at once when we launch a theme in IA, but because in OverlayUpdater, we do not launch the theme at all, but instead, we just let it update overlays in the background, so these decryption keys must be willingly given to substratum through a secured receiver tunnel. 

Once the v10.0.0 theme template is compiled, it generates a random set of keys of which the themer nor lead developers will know, so if you do lose your project files, you will be SOL. However, if you keep your theme backed up in GitLab or BitBucket on a private repo, you will be safe.

causes unintended behaviour where themed bootanimations and fonts do not

directory since they get created by the userspace applications when needed.

title: OverlayUpdater: Introduce functional method of automatically rebuilding
message:
OverlayUpdater: Introduce functional method of automatically rebuilding

This feature automatically rebuilds the overlays for an updated, target overlay.

For example, if YouTube gets updated from Play Store. Substratum will detect this and automatically start building the overlays based on the current overlay's metadata. As we already have a system that actually spits out perfect overlay metadata, we can use it to recompile exact overlays including all type1a/b/c/2/3 overlays automagically.

TODO: Show a notification while the packages are being updated in the background.
TODO2: Add a toggle in Settings to disable this feature. Feature should be disabled by default.

SettingsFragment: Make sure to catch network errors properly

title: SettingsFragment: Make sure to catch network errors properly
message:
SettingsFragment: Make sure to catch network errors properly

Currently all exceptions are passed as is to the onPostExecute method,
ignoring the case of potato internet connections where internet might
be connected but a random drop in the connection might cause a UnknownHostException
to be raised, causing something similar to this https://snag.gy/WE8Kha.jpg

To mitigate the issue, break away the UnknownHostException catch from the generic
Exception catch and return a blank string to indicate we got nothing, and handle the
blank string in the if else block in onPostExecute that actually sets the text

title: References: Type Annotation to @NonNull for checkOMS()
message:
References: Type Annotation to @NonNull for checkOMS()

By now we all know the fundamentals of Java8, however it should be noted that type annotations should not be used to enforce nullability. Which is why we have a secondary check to return true if the context is null, as we expect window refreshes to only be on OMS based ROMs.

However due to the nature of @NonNull type annotation, when our compiler detects a possible NPE inbound, it will warn us beforehand. While the code is running, it doesn't matter whether this type annotation is in place, a non null context can still be passed through, which is why our secondary check enforces it for us.

title: If something is not supported is......unsupported
message:
If something is not supported is......unsupported

Let's not pretend like something is not supported. If a ROM is not on the supported list then is either not supported. 

Quit this 'is not known'. Yes there is a rare chance that a ROM may be supported and not on the list but at that point is just because the developer of said ROM is lazy or doesn't care for Substratum in the first place. Let's not encourage laziness or mislead Substratum users because we want spare feelings here.

title: Wallpapers: Asciibetically sort the list of wallpapers excluding spaces
message:
Wallpapers: Asciibetically sort the list of wallpapers excluding spaces

According to this table: https://unicode-table.com/en/

We are able to see that "~" has a lower priority than "-" which is used to distinguish between the name and the preview of an image. As we do not want a symbol that would be distinguished by the asciibetical organization and order the wallpapers incorrectly, we must use a lower priority symbol to replace spaces from the XML. In the app, it will automatically convert the "~" to a space accordingly.

title: Themers, let's start getting on deck with Android O! Shall we?
message:
Themers, let's start getting on deck with Android O! Shall we?

Sorry for the delay, had exams to worry about.

Developers: We may want to look into an alternate approach when APIs are fully documented for Android O. The issue here was that the Stream was prematurely closed after performing a specific Process shell execution. 

The exact caught error is:

04-11 21:19:54.468 D/SubstratumBuilder: Overlay APK creation has completed!
04-11 21:19:54.469 W/System.err: java.io.IOException: Stream closed
04-11 21:19:54.469 W/System.err:     at java.lang.ProcessBuilder$NullOutputStream.write(ProcessBuilder.java:433)
04-11 21:19:54.469 W/System.err:     at java.io.OutputStream.write(OutputStream.java:116)

This commit was not necessary for Android N and below, however the highly undocumented API code for Android O may have changed a significant amount of things with regards to how things are being run.

Another look would be this log that complains after using the Process runtime execution:

04-11 20:47:47.623 E/Notification: Use of stream types is deprecated for operations other than volume control.
04-11 20:47:47.623 E/Notification: See the documentation of setSound() for what to use instead with android.media.AudioAttributes to qualify your playback use case

title: PackageModificationDetector: Completely revamp the detection module
message:
PackageModificationDetector: Completely revamp the detection module

We had many unnecessary BroadcastReceivers to check whether themes were
valid to be used. This commit removes all the unnecessary excess
checkers and updates to the latest algorithms to check for themes.

All packages are now dynamically checked using PackageManager's
EXTRA_REPLACING intent rather than us creating our own cache to see if
it is being updated or not

title: Add a basic indicator for whether a ROM is supported or not
message:
Add a basic indicator for whether a ROM is supported or not

Nick created a list of ROMs that were verified to have the necessary commits
to run Substratum properly with little to no jank. This 'mod' checks the
BUILD.PRODUCT prop against that list and determines which string to show in Settings.

This is done as simple as possible to not cause any inconvenience to the user. I do
advice it be kept like this because a dialog or anything beyond this will probably
annoy the user running an unsupported ROM.

If the user has a problem, the developers will ask for a screenshot of Settings
to see what the user is working with and this will show the developer at a glance
whether the ROM is on the list or not.

- I do not have access to all ROM build props so there's a chance there's wrong info
below. Please double check before merging

title: Update non-Theme Ready alert dialog
message:
Update non-Theme Ready alert dialog

Changed the alert dialog description from telling users to remove Theme Ready if they have it installed. This is an unnecessary demand for themers who do not support Theme Ready, because it will not affect any themes which do not require it to be used. Theme Ready supports the themers, they don't need to change anything in their themes to support it.

From now on, the showcase will not sort the list alphabetically by default (there's an icon on top to sort it alphabetically). By default, it will randomly jumble the ArrayList<ShowcaseItem> up so that every themer feels respected that their theme would have equal amount of chances to be shown at the top rather than adapting to the alphabetical nature.

title: Fix dynamic "favorite theme" app shortcut
message:
Fix dynamic "favorite theme" app shortcut

It seems that the dynamic shortcuts API adds the dynamic shortcuts
to the first available Activity with category.LAUNCHER.

Since we added LeakCanary Activity above our .LauncherActivity,
this resulted in the app shortcuts getting added to the "debugger"
launcher shortcut and not Substratum (in debug builds at least).

title: Check for ROM dirty flash and reset
message:
Check for ROM dirty flash and reset

Substratum is caching important checks about the ROM's configuration,
which are integral to its function.

A ROM flash can change, break or disable a lot of these checks.

Make Substratum aware of the build date of the ROM (universal
across all AOSP builds) and force it to clear its data if a
dirty flash is found, so it can run all the checks again on the
next run.

Conflicts:
	app/src/main/res/values/strings.xml

title: BootAnimations: Rewrite algorithm to determine bootanimation previews
message:
BootAnimations: Rewrite algorithm to determine bootanimation previews

On many themes, there are bootanimations that are very small but contain a lot of frames. As the frames get larger, the amount of memory needing to play them gets higher, all the way till an OutOfMemoryException, ultimately telling the user that they ran out of memory.

On my Nexus 6P, the app's VM reached a whopping 770mb, then just outright rejected to play the bootanimation. What a waste! With this commit, the app will now slim dynamically check how many files there are in the boot animation cache, and determine using an algorithm whether the resampling size for the image has to be modified or not.

This patch went from a 770mb exploded VM to a steady 111mb maintained VM, with a properly playing bootanimation.

title: ThemeUninstallDetector: Do not trip overlay cleansing on theme upgrades
message:
ThemeUninstallDetector: Do not trip overlay cleansing on theme upgrades

By using PACKAGE_FULLY_REMOVED over PACKAGE_REMOVED intent, we are able to filter which of the intents were actually uninstalled, rather than just a simple dummy intent from post-upgrading apps.

This will solve deactivated overlays/restarting SystemUI when upgrading an applied theme.

title: Check if ROM has our system feature
message:
Check if ROM has our system feature

We created our <feature name="projekt.substratum.theme" /> permission to allow the Play Store
to filter Substratum themes based on which theme platform the user's ROM is using
(OMS7 / legacy RRO2):
https://github.com/substratum/masquerade/blob/n-rootless/projekt.substratum.theme.xml

Until now we only checked for OMS version and assumed that the ROM has properly included our
custom permission.

This commit adds the official way of checking if the ROM actually provides said feature, producing
the following output in Settings if there is a problem:
http://i.imgur.com/TZoL32y.png

title: ThemeFragment: don't get so trigger happy
message:
ThemeFragment: don't get so trigger happy

ThemeManager.listOverlays(1) will never return null but empty list because of this:
https://github.com/SubstratumResources/platform_frameworks_base/blob/1901186a091794a5da7b719542513c46675adb12/core/java/android/content/om/IOverlayManager.aidl#L30

Guard against that.

This solves rogue uninstall commands with empty ArrayLists getting sent to interfacer, producing the following output, each time Substratum was launched:
03-06 18:40:07.960 8001-8001/projekt.interfacer E/JobService: 'projekt.substratum' is not an authorized calling package, but the user has explicitly allowed all calling packages, validating calling package permissions...
03-06 18:40:07.961 8001-8001/projekt.interfacer E/JobService: Starting job with primary command 'uninstall', with job time: 1488818407958

title: ThemeManager: Introduce blacklisting overlays to safeguard the system
message:
ThemeManager: Introduce blacklisting overlays to safeguard the system

To pass Google Sony and LineageOS' CTS, we must have an implementation
that safeguards certain packages and services from being overlaid.

To add more packages, append to the end of the String[].

We must filter out the masquerade package so that rogue themers would
not intentionally try to disrupt a user's set up, ensuring that the
system's integrity is matched to team standards.

title: InformationActivity: Revamp the favorites icon, introduce changelogging
message:
InformationActivity: Revamp the favorites icon, introduce changelogging

Themers just have to add:

    <string-array name="ThemeChangelog">
        <item>Test1</item>
        <item>Test2</item>
        <item>Test3</item>
        <item>Test4</item>
        <item>Test5</item>
        <item>Test6</item>
        <item>Test7</item>
        <item>Test8</item>
        <item>Test9</item>
    </string-array>

Where each of the tests are an individual change the themer wants to inform the user. The String[] will automatically be parsed and thus be added with automatic newlines and bullet points.

Favorites icon will solidify or empty depending on whether the theme is favorited now.

title: CacheCreator: Recalculate optimized SystemUI refresh modulo algorithm
message:
CacheCreator: Recalculate optimized SystemUI refresh modulo algorithm

We should try limit as many SystemUI leaks as possible. By limiting it down to notifying the notification once every 200 files extracted, it would not extract like crazy, when big themes like Swift or Spectrum with 17000 files+ gets extracted.

This will also allow the notification's button to be easily pressed if the user wants to cancel a huge operation.

title: FileOperations: new rootless createNewFolder
message:
FileOperations: new rootless createNewFolder

Expand createNewFolder with rootless method, following the logic set by the
other methods found in FileOperations.
It requires the "mkdir" job commit in Masquerade.
It allows creating the "/data/system/theme" folder, that's why "MasqueradeJobService"
checks are added (so the root dialog doesn't appear in rootless mode).

a combined work with KreAch3R.

title: FloatUI: Rewrite algorithm to show proper foreground tasks accurately
message:
FloatUI: Rewrite algorithm to show proper foreground tasks accurately

To replicate: While in FloatUI mode, swipe down the status bar/QS and if your finger slides to a different app's notification, the app detected would be different.

By implementing a new algorithm with usage delay, we are able to accurately monitor what is being shown as a foreground of the user's screen to allow FloatUI to properly identify the correct package name.

title: Revert "MainActivity: Clear the /.substratum/ folder when starting the app"
message:
Revert "MainActivity: Clear the /.substratum/ folder when starting the app"

There has been some cases where the first few overlays were updated, then MainActivity reloaded.

By the nature of window refreshes, it is like a stack where when an activity is refreshed of assets, each activity and fragment stack would be reloaded and simulated that they have been loaded consecutively in one flicker.

MainActivity was in charge of deleting overlay APKs and when it refreshed in InformationActivity, MainActivity reloaded it's onCreate method, thus loading the overlay folder remover.

title: SubstratumUI: When the cache breaks, let user wipe immediately
message:
SubstratumUI: When the cache breaks, let user wipe immediately

Before this patch, an ambiguous toast will say that it is upgrading in the background, but there is no notification.

Substratum will now check if there is a notification in SystemUI. If there is, then it is upgrading normally. If there isn't, then the cache wipe snackbar will pop up alerting the user to wipe the cache and reset flags, as they probably FCd Substratum while cache was upgrading.

title: References: When a theme is launched, ALWAYS check for AOPT integrity
message:
References: When a theme is launched, ALWAYS check for AOPT integrity

This will go through two checks, 

1) Substratum will re-attempt to reinject default AAPT and reset the flags in SharedPrefs, if it fails again, then
2) It will alert the user about what's going on before proceeding any further (or even launch the theme).

title: MainActivity: Search query should not reload fragment on icon click
message:
MainActivity: Search query should not reload fragment on icon click

Add checks for when a user clicks on the search button and the fragment does an extra reload.

When the search button is clicked, the query immediately goes to "" and userInput (our global variable) has been changed, ultimately leading to one fragment change. Adding this commit will check whether the query is actual a real user query and thus reloading based on real input rather than an icon press.

rest of the app in preparations for the no-root rebase.

title: SubstratumRebase: We're now on steroids in terms of load speed!
message:
SubstratumRebase: We're now on steroids in terms of load speed!

Kill off non-6.0.0 theme templates in preparation for the month-long delay for themes. This completely kills load time when loading a different tab from the navigation drawer (e.g. Overlays, Fonts, Boot Animations, Sound Packs and Wallpapers)

This speeds things up by 50x original speeds (from 2 secs -> 0.04secs (40ms))

AOPT check now only happens on the Home Fragment to further optimize the fragment switching.

As we are only looking for specific packages under a specific intent filter, this no longer is an algorithm that is directly proportional to how many packages (input) are located on the device with a complexity of O(n), but rather a more refined algorithm that runs through a complexity of O(logn)

title: Studio: Introduce the dynamic icon masking cropping algorithm
message:
Studio: Introduce the dynamic icon masking cropping algorithm

This commit will dynamically check whether the iconMask attribute specified by icon pack designers follows an icon cropper guideline or whether it is a simple overlay mask. 

The icon cropper algorithm checks 4 specific pixel zones (top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right) whether they all match and converges them into one function to check whether they are black. If they are, this is a properly set icon crop mask. Thanks a lot to @nathanchance.

If they are not black, or the pixels don't align properly, they will be classified as an overlaying mask, where the icon is not cropped, for example themes that just place a mask as a background/foreground.

This commit also adds support for reading more XML tags from icon packs to take account for missing icon-* parameters.

title: SubstratumBuilder: Introduce target app referencing (AppCompat)
message:
SubstratumBuilder: Introduce target app referencing (AppCompat)

This commit allows for themers to call upon private resources defined by the public.xml file in the decompiled theme.

Theoretically, this means that themers can now use:

@*com.google.android.apps.plus:style/Theme.AppCompat
@*com.android.systemui:drawable/icon
@*com.android.systemui:string/data_usage_uninstalled_apps
@*com.android.systemui:dimen/fab_size
@*com.android:systemui:id/scrollView
@*com.android.systemui:plurals/status_bar_accessibility_recent_apps
@*com.android.systemui:integer/long_press_dock_anim_duration
@*com.android.systemui:layout/lb_header
@*com.android.systemui:attr/guidedActionDescriptionMinLines
@*com.android.systemui:interpolator/lockscreen_fingerprint_error_state_to_fp_animation_interpolator_0
@*com.android.systemui:array/color_mode_names
@*com.android.systemui:bool/config_sendPackageName

With the resolution of calling Theme.AppCompat as a parent by the self-referencing AOPT modifications, it would resolve issues where crashes occur when the style is "not complete".

title: IconStudio: Initial contribution to the icon pack framework
message:
IconStudio: Initial contribution to the icon pack framework

- Properly buffers all the icon packs in an AsyncTask on a GridLayoutManager
RecyclerView layout, with 4 being the max amount of objects on the X scale.

- The FAB shows up in each of the preview activities

- The selector screen gets buffered within milliseconds on the packages
that use a launcher based metadata (Nova Launcher filter).

- Implemented function to quickly grab the exact locations within each
target APK (APK to receive an icon pack overlay) for its launcher icons,
e.g. if an app used /res/drawable-nodpi-v13/launcher_magnificent.png as
the launcher icon, Substratum now fully reads all of this and implements
it in a documented HashMap function for further calls and API hooks later
down the road.

- Replicate a new SubstratumBuilder to allow for icon packs to be compiled
specifically with respect to new metadata tags and package naming convention.

- Introduce the compilation system that compiles full packs at once

- Introduce a new blur dialog specifically for icon packs

- All downloaded icon packs will be scrutinized by Substratum. If there is a
rogue icon inside the icon pack, it will announce for the Icon Pack themer
where the issue is, for example, if an icon pack is missing a drawable resource
then it will complain under ResourceTypes that there is no package identifier
when getting value for a 0x000000000 resource number.

- The Icon Pack Studio framework will dynamically overlay all resolutions
when only one icon is applied, for example, icon packs usually have one
resolution for icons, 192x192. However, when overlaying to system, we need to
ensure that the icons get overlaid on all DPI scales, so it will be automatically
resized to fit each resolution respectively.

- The Icon Pack Studio will not overlay system applications, such as SystemUI,
even though Icon Pack themers do not theme these icons on any launcher anyways,
it has been added to the safeguard that these icons (SystemUI) are dangerous
to overlay simply with a drawable PNG, as the icons are linked with deep-framework
changes.

- The Icon Pack Studio will refuse to overlay an Icon Pack dashboard application,
as this seems redundant.

- The Icon Pack Studio will filter out only the visible applications with a valid
Java activity will be overlaid. As this is meant to theme "Launcher" icons, it makes
most sense that only visible icons be overlaid.

- The Icon Pack Studio will filter out all the activities found on the system and
dynamically decide whether which activity is "most-fit" for use by the Icon Pack
Studio using the Substratum Best Match algorith. This prevents the Settings icon
from turning into the Bluetooth icon, as many icon pack devs theme specific
activities occassionally.

- The Icon Pack Studio solely relies on OMS7, and masquerade 20 to communicate
specific commands to refresh the windows.

- Framework and Substratum overlays will trigger the update_mode flag, so we make sure
that it is set to be configured to the end onPostExecute, just before being sent
to masquerade for further instructions.

- Make sure Advanced Manager and OverlaysTab does not crash by using a filter.

SubstratumRebase: Overview of all Java files in Substratum (~77)

This cleans up every single Java file in the Substratum repository ~77
files, and respects all the lint complaints. I have also done the
liberty of cleaning up unnecessary lines of code and replaced redundant
code with efficient ones.

All Java headers (Created by nicholaschum) have been removed as this
is a team project rather than myself. Remove all of these to encourage
community development.

- OverlaysList

title: SubstratumRebase: Consolidate Root commands into References
message:
SubstratumRebase: Consolidate Root commands into References

This rebase commits moves all of the root commands in Substratum into
one centralized area for further progress in the upcoming commits.

We should consolidate the ThreadRunner class but this is awaiting the
Masquerade overhaul to handle the OverlayManagerService natively.

Should one find themselves stumbling across this commit, this commit
allows for References.java to control most if not all root calls on the
app, and thus when the team implements the no-root system it would be
easy to transition over in a snap.

title: InformationTabsAdapter: Rewrite all the logic and simplify
message:
InformationTabsAdapter: Rewrite all the logic and simplify

This adapter took many code reviews and many peoples precious time but
finally after an epiphany I found one of the better ways of organizing
this to consolidate the whole logic into one proper function that
processes each tab dynamically.

The ArrayList will now be the temporary cache of what is remaining in
terms of what tabs have been instantiated prior to relaunching another
tab. If a tab is spawned, remove itself from the ArrayList so the
remaining tabs would not have a chance to respawn the same fragment
again.

title: SubstratumUI: Introduce a brand new card layout for themes
message:
SubstratumUI: Introduce a brand new card layout for themes

This commit introduces a new card interface for all the fragments, by
upgrading the themes to template version 2.1.4, it will now include the
Substratum_ThemeReady metadata, with three different values injectable
to interact with Substratum: all, ready, stock

all: will activate both the sun and the moon icons, meaning that your
theme has resources that can theme both Theme Ready Google Apps and
Stock Google Apps

ready: will activate only the moon icon, meaning that your theme only
has resources that can theme Theme Ready Google Apps.

stock: will activate only the sun icon, meaning that your theme only
has resources that can theme Theme Ready Google Apps.

Leaving the metadata out or entering an incorrect value would disable
the visibility of these icons.

This commit also cleans up the whole logic behind launching themes by
several hundred lines per fragment (~5) roughly a reduction of 30% of
the code in each fragment, thus allowing for speed enhancements to be
in full throttle, including preparing the code for future modifications.

title: OverlaysList: fail_count must be less than overlays building
message:
OverlaysList: fail_count must be less than overlays building

This commit fixes an issue where when an two overlays (one works, one
is broken) are built, it should build and enable/update as usual. But
if we build one broken overlay, it proceeds to request masquerade to
enable it (with the progress bar). This is unintended behaviour and has
been fixed.

SubstratumUI: MainActivity popup menu clears substratum_state

On dire circumstances, when a user needs to clear the substratum state
(if they are getting a toast saying Theme is upgrading), all they
have to do is use any of the following.

1. Refresh Windows
2. Restart SystemUI
3. Reboot Device
4. Soft Reboot

title: CacheCreator: All file count + modulo 50 for smaller themes
message: CacheCreator: All file count + modulo 50 for smaller themes

title: Notifications: Brand new UI to interact with Resource Initializer
message:
Notifications: Brand new UI to interact with Resource Initializer

Introduce a brand new way for the user to interact with the automated
resource cache initializer. The user can now cancel and expand the
themes at a later date.

A notification will pop up when a theme gets installed, and it will
show live progress of the expansion. Once complete, it dismisses itself
and shows the notification saying it was successful. There is no
failure notification for this.

This also allows the user to see when they clean the cache of the app.
If by any chance the users Substratum application terminates while the
notification is expanding (held on an X% for too long), the Cancel
button will automatically reset the state of is_updating, as to
increase the chances to prevent the A theme is upgrading in the
background toast.

title: SubstratumUI: Increase Antipiracy Checks by 3x
message:
SubstratumUI: Increase Antipiracy Checks by 3x

Depending on your build, Substratum will now speed up the integrity of
the verification system after the first check of your themes by 3 times
the original. Any subsequent launches of themes from each fragment
would load instantaneously (even faster if theres no Theme Ready
Dialog popup).

However, if you have Lucky Patcher installed on your device, this
commit would be of no difference.

This commit, thus, eliminates subsequent theme lag until any of the
three conditions are met below:

- A theme has been updated
- A theme has been installed
- Substratum has been reinstalled.

title: SubstratumBuilder: Allow for overlays to be built for Nougat
message:
SubstratumBuilder: Allow for overlays to be built for Nougat

Android N introduces a new function to enforce the hasCode function
on the enforceCodePolicy() method. By default it is set to true, to
maximize compatibility with applications already on the Play Store.
However, overlay APKs do not have any code in them, hence they are
always treated as hasCode=true on Nougat. This commit cleans up that
functionality and forces it to say hasCode=false so the system will
let it install.

title: SubstratumUI: Revive functionality to refresh overlays on demand
message:
SubstratumUI: Revive functionality to refresh overlays on demand

When a user uninstalls a theme pack, the home fragment (and all
subsequent fragments) should automatically refresh, thus cleaning up
the workspace.

Prior to this commit, Substratum has been using its failsafe of
checking whether the package exists when the user clicks on a card.
This will fall back as the failsafe again as this new implementation is
fully automated.

title: InformationActivity: Introduce a less memory intensive hero load
message:
InformationActivity: Introduce a less memory intensive hero load

When launching InformationActivity, one of the most time consuming
parts is to extract the bitmap out of the APK and then loading the
image, all before the user sees the activity.

This should not be the case and thus this commit allows for the images
to be loaded asynchronously through a byte[] after a conversion from a
bitmap drawable. This will also allow the InformationActivity to speed
up launching by 2x.

commit will amend this issue.

title: OverlaysList: Do not allow user to multi-click on fab sheet options
message:
OverlaysList: Do not allow user to multi-click on fab sheet options

In some point in time, a user can quickly tap on a fab sheet menu such
as (BUILD + ENABLE) object more than once, thus causing two concurrent
jobs to run SubstratumBuilder.

This commit prevents this behaviour from occurring in the future.

title: ReadOverlaysFile: Rewrite for efficient overlay state checks
message:
ReadOverlaysFile: Rewrite for efficient overlay state checks

This commit deprecates the old way of ReadOverlaysFile, which was to
duplicate the overlays.xml file in /data/system and parses the XML
language. This was proven to not be as useful as the overlays.xml file
could report back incorrect information depending on the user.

om list is an efficient and reliable way to deduce what overlays are
enabled, disabled or non-approved without the use of root (to access
/data/system) as well as without the need of copying files.

This will cut down the process to a fraction of the previous time, as
well as alleviate the I/O and root calls on the device.

title: Priorities: Do not log down when fromPos == toPos

go, go back to the original position. It would have shown a fab and
applying would result in an error.

This commit fixes that behaviour.

lot of FCs and we will look into this further later.

immediately reflected in the database (when a whole theme is removed).

message:
AntiPiracy: Integration to crawl theme's DEX package for verity

This commit introduces a whitelist so that themes that have rogue or
potentially fraudulent classes will not be executed through Substratum.

The whitelist will sit in References.java:

String[] allowed_package_name = {
"android.support",
"com.a.a.a",
"com.google.android.vending.licensing",
"substratum.theme.template",
packageName
};

This ensures the anti piracy is intact and users cant bypass it
through the notification window.

title: References: Move theme filter to References and change for 170
message:
References: Move theme filter to References and change for 170

This marks the first specified date where themers must change their
metadata based on an announcement.

This will happen more frequently to keep themers up to date with the
latest Substratum source.

All strings are changeable from References.java which controls 16 other
files and its variables. If there is a need to change it in the
future, change it here.

NOTE TO DEVS: Never expose this to an array file as themers can
possibly change it - hardcode it using the References.java file.

title: SubstratumUI: Take account for template default activity location
message:
SubstratumUI: Take account for template default activity location

If a themer does not refactor the themes package but instead keeps the
stock substratum.theme.template package directories for the Java
files, it should not report back theme needing to be updated. Instead,
check whether the the activity exists on
substratum.theme.template.SubstratumLauncher before proceeding to
check com.packagename.theme.SubstratumLauncher.

title: LegacyMode: Finalize features
message:
LegacyMode: Finalize features

- Filter notification to only accept Legacy based themes on legacy
mode. However Substratum themes (non-legacy) will still be parsed by
Sounds fragment the same way.

- Themer specified priorities now work by placing a priority file at
the root of each overlay. Just like the type1a/type1b file that
specifies the spinner name, this works the same way.

- Automatically clear Substratum directory on SharedPreference
violation. This helps clear out profiles that are from an OMS ROM ->
Legacy, or Legacy -> OMS.

title: SubstratumUI: v70
message:
SubstratumUI: v70

- Deprecate the use of AssetManager in places that need user loading
- Now uses its own app cache (themes will now install their caches on
the app)
- When an app is updated, the cache is updated too
- Separate many of the classes out so that we dont have to tie
everything into fragments/activities, instead, just have it in a
different file
- Fix notification display logic. Multiple notifications when called
will now show up as separate options
- Before loading any overlays, check verity of the Substratum cache for
the specific overlay

title: BootAnimation: Handle BootAnimation Previews Dynamically
message:
BootAnimation: Handle BootAnimation Previews Dynamically

This loads the BootAnimation previews based on their file size. This
allows for bigger boot animations to buffer the whole thing without
causing an OutOfMemory exception.

SubstratumUI: Rebase Root commands to Kernel Auditor's version

Thanks to @USA-RedDragon for the files, and thanks to Kernel Auditors
open source work for Substratums root commands to be rebased.

Why: This creates one shell at the start of the app and will run it
under that shell instead of creating a new superuser shell every time a
new command needs to be run.

title: BootAnimation: Handle VM explosions with placeholder text
message:
BootAnimation: Handle VM explosions with placeholder text

This handles the VM OutOfMemoryException when a boot animation loads
its images to a bitmap file in Substratum and blows up the cache while
it adds the images in.

title: SubstratumBuilder: When using Type3 folders, have a fallback /res
message:
SubstratumBuilder: When using Type3 folders, have a fallback /res

When the user picks a Type3 folder option, they should have a check
whether each folder COMES with the same Type3 folder that is exactly
named in framework, then it will build - however if they could not find
the folder, it will fallback to /res.

title: Introduce the ThemeDetect Service

Introduce the ThemeDetect Service

With this service, we can periodically check whether new themes are
installed onto the device. A notification will be shown in the
notification panel saying that a specific theme has been installed.

title: Introduce Anti-piracy Security Mechanism
message:
Introduce Anti-piracy Security Mechanism

This mechanism is based on creating metadata tags in each of the
overlay it creates including the devices IMEI and unique identifier
address.

If a foreign overlay APK has been found, the purge Async will run in
the background (in a toast, just in case it has to refresh the windows)

title: MainActivity: Implement SwipeRefreshLayout and handle uninstalls
message:
MainActivity: Implement SwipeRefreshLayout and handle uninstalls

Because people are allowed to handle uninstalls from within another
activity, if they go back an activity and try to click into the
uninstalled package, do not allow it to have an NPE, but instead
refresh the layout.
